fields.description:
Raised by a customer.
Steps to reproduce:
{quote}
I created a space and in Browse Space > Space Admin>Mail account > Add new Mail Account, I entered my work mail server name, account name, username and password. Now, all my emails are imported to this space and got deleted from my email server. BTW, I didn't do the import, I just click the test connection button and it imported all my emails.
{quote}

A button that is named "Test Connection" should not download all emails. 
Once in confluence it is very difficult to reverse
fields.summary: Clicking "test connection" during a setup of Mail Account will trigger a download of all email.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11966].
  {panel}

The confluence CLI does not have an option to export an entire wiki space in the wiki syntax. Currently, the confluence CLI only enables us to export a wiki space in XML, PDF, and HTML formats. Adding another option to export the wiki space in the wiki syntax format would be useful for backups.

I'm not sure if there is another way to do this. If there is, please let me know.

Thanks,
NIlesh
fields.summary: support for exporting a wiki space in the wiki syntax format is missing in the confluence CLI

fields.description: We use shortcut links all over the place.  For example, we have a shortcut for jira.  [XXX-1@jiraissue] links to the XXX-1 issue.  If this page is moved, you get [OLDSPACENAME:XXX-1@jiraissue] which clearly breaks the link!  This is a serious error as we now have a lot of messed up pages!!!!  Too late now for us, but needs to be fixed for the next poor person.  Looking at the number of existing and past issues with this capability, it really needs to be thought out a bit better and fixed permanently.
fields.summary: Moving page with shortcuts to an new space incorrectly adds old space name

fields.description:
The table of contents macro and tasklist macro, as bundled with 2.8.1, break each other when included on the same page.

The toc renders as an error: "Error formatting macro: toc: java.lang.IllegalStateException: No match available"
The tasklist renders correctly if it is before the toc, or renders *without any tasks* if it is after the toc.

The stacktrace that occurs is in the logs is attached.


{panel:title=original report}
After upgrading from confluence 2.3.1 to 2.8.1 the TOC-Macro not working, when using dynamictasklist macro from the dynamictasklist2 plugin. Both marcos working when using each on a seperate page.

Error Message from the toc-Macro is:
Error formatting macro: toc: java.lang.IllegalStateException: No match available

And the dynamictask list ist show empty (also when there are task shown befor and still exists in wiki-markup page source) and i am not able to add new tasks.

Version of Table of Contents plugin is 2.4.5 and of Dynamictasklist2 3.0.4.
{panel}
fields.summary: TOC-Macro and DynamicTasklist2-Macro do not work on the same page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11929].
  {panel}

Hi all,

Sorry if the requirement already exists.
Currently in the Checklists plugin and when the user sets the sort parameter to 'modified' or 'created', the layout of the pages in the table is on a descending way.

I think the user should be allowed to choose the way he wants to display the page. I mean sort the pages on ascending or descending based on the created date or modified date.

Cheers,
Stephane
fields.summary: checklist and sort on ascending
Email notification when emails are fetched

fields.description:
Upon enabling LDAP integration for users and groups it appears the more LDAP groups a users belongs too the slower each confluence page request takes to complete. Using the performance profile feature it seems Confluence retrieves a list of all groups a user belongs to (even though only 1 or 2 of these exist in Confluence) and checks them to see if the user should have access. Can this is changed so Confluence checks if a user belongs to the defined access groups instead of the other way around and therefore the number of groups a user belongs to does not matter?

To prove this i've created two users; one belonging to just one group and the other belonging to twenty groups. The performacne profile output shows page requests for the user with twenty groups take about 60-70% longer to complete.
fields.summary: LDAP performance degrades the more LDAP groups a user belongs too

fields.description:
It will be helpful to have an informational link to the Confluence's doc on how certain features are created.

In example, user needs to construct a navigation sidebar as in this page:

* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Confluence+Documentation+Home

However, there is no informational link to explain how the navigation sidebar can be created. The proposed link, in this case, should direct the user to 

* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Adding+a+Navigation+Sidebar

fields.description:
I found a bug trying to link to pages in different spaces. If you click the link icon in the Rich Text editor and locate a page to link to, it correctly shows the link as space:Page Link. But when you click OK, it gets inserted into the page without the "space:" in front  of the page link. Confluence then thinks this is a new page in the current space.

To reproduce this behavior...
1) use the rich text editor's add/edit link button
2) browse for a page in another space (either search or select from history)
3) do NOT create an "alias" for the page

Although the "link" appears correct, upon saving the page, the link is transformed into a link to a page within the current space, most likely an undefined page.
fields.summary: Rich text editor - add link to another space results in a link to current space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-11917].
  {panel}

When Confluence has delegated the user management to JIRA, it is expected that customer will not add any user within Confluence - hence the External User Management option is set to ON in the General Configuration. 

When customer decides to add a user internally in Confluence (External User Management is set to OFF), they will encounter the following error message:

{noformat}
 Cause:
com.atlassian.core.exception.InfrastructureException: com.atlassian.user.EntityException: Was unable to create user [pwhite] but the credentials provider [bucket.user.providers.CachingCredentialsProvider@edac1] did not say why.
 at bucket.user.DefaultUserAccessor.addUser(DefaultUserAccessor.java:102)
caused by: com.atlassian.user.EntityException: Was unable to create user [pwhite] but the credentials provider [bucket.user.providers.CachingCredentialsProvider@edac1] did not say why.
 at com.atlassian.user.impl.osuser.OSUUserManager.createUser(OSUUserManager.java:91)
{noformat}

While the exception is caught and the error message is logged, the information is not very helpful to the customer.

We need a better error message that can be understood more easily.
fields.summary: Improve error message which appears when trying to add a user while JIRA user management is enabled

fields.description:
This has existed for quite some time. If the retrieval / creation of a user fails, the entire system will grind to a halt as the lock will never be released. The CachingCredentialsProvider in bucket has synchronisation on its internal "handlesCache" for almost all operations.

https://svn.atlassian.com/privateeye/browse/private/atlassian/bucket/trunk/src/main/java/bucket/user/providers/CachingCredentialsProvider.java

This problem only affects installations using OSUser user management, which which was the default prior to Confluence 2.7. For Confluence 2.4.x and higher which are using the default user management configuration, we recommend migrating to Hibernate user management as described here:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+to+new+User+Management

This migration is done automatically for users with a default configuration when upgrading to 2.7 or later.

Customers who have customised their user management with OSUser (either for LDAP support or JIRA user management) should not attempt this migration.

*Diagnosis:* The way to diagnose this problem is to [take a thread dump|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Generating+a+Thread+Dump] when the system is slow. If the slowness is caused by this bug, you will see many threads in the BLOCKED state in the CachingCredentialsProvider class. If you do not see CachingCredentialsProvider in your thread dump, but Confluence is running slowly, please [raise a support case|http://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=12].
fields.summary: Confluence slows down due to CachingCredentialsProvider synchronisation for creation and retrieval of users

fields.description:
The "View change" link in an email provides a diff between the previous version and the *current* version.  At the time the email is sent out, that link is valid. As soon as the page changes again, the link is inappropriate as it *still* diffs the previous version and the *current* version, rather than the version the email is about.

This is because the links are of the form:
http://example.com/pages/diffpages.action?pageId=671416524&originalId=703954960
rather than 
http://example.com/pages/diffpagesbyversion.action?pageId=671416524&revisedVersion=5&originalVersion=6
fields.summary: "View change"-link from email links to incorrect set of changes if the page got updated afterwards

Within one of my spaces, the blog-post macro does not work.  I was doing some routine maintenance, and posted an update on the news to inform others of the maintenance.  Then I realized it wasn't posting.  If I tell it to post all news from all spaces, it will show other news, but not the news it its own space.  It simply says "No news found."  If I go into Browse Space, the news items show up in the News tab and on the calendar.

Then, while scanning the options in Browse space, I realized it is not populating the attachments tab either.  Individual pages will say they have x number of attachments, but the space as a whole shows 0.

I moving the pages, deleting the space, and moving them to the new space with no success.

fields.description:
Per http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Global+Permissions+Overview#GlobalPermissionsOverview-ComparingtheAdministratorPermissionswiththeconfluenceadministratorsGroup and https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-18893, even if a user or a group to which he belongs has System Administrator permissions, the user is in fact not a system administrator as he does not automatically have permissions on all wiki spaces.

Problem: In virtually all other products I've used, System Administrator literally means an "administrator" of the entire "system." Confluence has apparently created a new definition for System Administrator where you are an administrator of some things but not of others.

Preferred resolution: Give us the ability to apply an "administrator of the entire system" privilege to arbitrary accounts or groups. My Confluence install is integrated with Active Directory via LDAP, and we would institutionally prefer to use LDAP to assign permissions. Forcing us to use a local group runs contrary to a key benefit of LDAP integration.

If the preferred resolution is not possible, it would be good to either 1. clarify in the product that the privilege called System Administrator is not in fact a true system administrator privilege or 2. rename the privilege to something that couldn't be confused with a system administrator privilege.
fields.summary: System Administrator permissions do not work as implied

fields.description:
When a space has gotten rather large (say a few thousand pages), the pagetree navigation will slow the browser if switched on during editing a page in that space.  This is particularly a problem in flat pages.  See also: CONF-11998 

*User symptoms:* The page list is essentially on every edit page when the _Locations_ control is listed. Hence when editing in a large space this will cause the JavaScript that is loading the page tree to run forever and often triggers browser warnings saying that a script is taking too long to run, as well as balloon the memory usage of the browser into the several hundred MB range.
fields.summary: Pagetree component causing errors in large spaces

fields.summary: System Error when more than one user in a group

fields.description:
This affects both Clustered and non clustered environments. 

The LDAP cache names by default are like below

{code:xml}
		<cache-mapping>
			<cache-name>com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.LDAPUserManagerReadOnly.users</cache-name>
			<scheme-name>user</scheme-name>
		</cache-mapping>

		<cache-mapping>
			<cache-name>com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.LDAPUserManagerReadOnly.users_ro</cache-name>
			<scheme-name>user</scheme-name>
		</cache-mapping>

		<cache-mapping>
			<cache-name>com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.LDAPUserManagerReadOnly.repositories</cache-name>
			<scheme-name>user</scheme-name>
		</cache-mapping>

		<cache-mapping>
			<cache-name>com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.LDAPGroupManagerReadOnly.groups</cache-name>
			<scheme-name>user</scheme-name>
		</cache-mapping>
		<cache-mapping>
			<cache-name>com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.LDAPGroupManagerReadOnly.groups_hasMembership</cache-name>
			<scheme-name>user</scheme-name>
		</cache-mapping>
		<cache-mapping>
			<cache-name>com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.LDAPGroupManagerReadOnly.groups_getGroupsForUser</cache-name>
			<scheme-name>user</scheme-name>
		</cache-mapping>
		<cache-mapping>
			<cache-name>com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.LDAPGroupManagerReadOnly.repositories</cache-name>
			<scheme-name>user</scheme-name>
		</cache-mapping>
{code}

However they should be as below 

{code:xml}
        <cache-mapping>
            <cache-name>com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.LDAPUserManagerReadOnly.ldapRepository.users</cache-name>
            <scheme-name>user</scheme-name>
        </cache-mapping>
        <cache-mapping>
            <cache-name>com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.LDAPUserManagerReadOnly.ldapRepository.users_ro</cache-name>
            <scheme-name>user</scheme-name>
        </cache-mapping>
        <cache-mapping>
            <cache-name>com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.LDAPUserManagerReadOnly.ldapRepository.repository</cache-name>
            <scheme-name>user</scheme-name>
        </cache-mapping>

        <cache-mapping>
            <cache-name>com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.LDAPGroupManagerReadOnly.ldapRepository.groups</cache-name>
            <scheme-name>user</scheme-name>
        </cache-mapping>
        <cache-mapping>
            <cache-name>com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.LDAPGroupManagerReadOnly.ldapRepository.groups_hasMembership</cache-name>
            <scheme-name>user</scheme-name>
        </cache-mapping>
        <cache-mapping>
            <cache-name>com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.LDAPGroupManagerReadOnly.ldapRepository.groups_getGroupsForUser</cache-name>
            <scheme-name>user</scheme-name>
        </cache-mapping>
        <cache-mapping>
            <cache-name>com.atlassian.user.impl.ldap.LDAPGroupManagerReadOnly.ldapRepository.repositories</cache-name>
            <scheme-name>user</scheme-name>
        </cache-mapping>
{code}

Also, the following caches are not defined (by default) and you should add them

{code:xml}
		<cache-mapping>
            <cache-name>com.atlassian.user.impl.hibernate.HibernateUserManager.hibernateRepository.users</cache-name>
            <scheme-name>user</scheme-name>
        </cache-mapping>
        <cache-mapping>
            <cache-name>com.atlassian.user.impl.hibernate.HibernateUserManager.hibernateRepository.users_ro</cache-name>
            <scheme-name>user</scheme-name>
        </cache-mapping>
        <cache-mapping>
            <cache-name>com.atlassian.user.impl.hibernate.HibernateUserManager.hibernateRepository.repository</cache-name>
            <scheme-name>user</scheme-name>
        </cache-mapping>
{code}
fields.summary: Changes to LDAP cache settings are not being picked up due to incorrect name of cache.

fields.description:
Cache names for atlassian-user elements are incorrect, results in using default configuration (1000 items)

I'm not sure how long these have been broken, but they are definitely broken in 2.8 and probably have been this way for quite some time.

This results in the cache settings 'appearing' to be unchangeable, as the files we supply and all the documentation we reference are incorrect.
fields.summary: Performance degrades after upgrade - Some internal caches are always 1000 items big, reconfiguring them doesn't work
Remove attachment action submitted via GET rather than POST

fields.description:
When editing a page in wiki markup, the editor jumps to the top of the page after using the image/link insertion buttons.

This is annoying since the user has to look up again the specific location where the link or images was inserted.
fields.summary: Image/link insertion in wiki markup makes the editor jump to the top of the page

fields.description:
*+Problem:+*
Confluence 2.8.0 didn't start up on Websphere 6.1 (extact version is 6.1.0.9).
In the logs the following can be found (see also attached log snippet):
{code}
creating bean with name 'sessionFactory' defined in class path resource [productionDatabaseContext.xml]: Invocation of init method failed; nested exception is java.lang.LinkageError: LinkageError while defining class: javax.managemen
t.MBeanServer
[...]
java.lang.ClassFormatError
        [...]
        at com.mchange.v2.c3p0.management.ActiveManagementCoordinator.attemptManageC3P0Registry(ActiveManagementCoordinator.java:52)
{code}

The problem could be tracked down to the JMX bean, that c3p0 tries to start internally in file ActiveManagementCoordinator.java, line 52.

*+Workaround:+*
Since this problem did'nt occur with Confluence 2.7.2 (the last version I installed), I simply replaced the c3p0-0.9.1.2.jar in Confluence-2.8 with the c3p0-0.9.0.4.jar from Confluence 2.7.2.
This solved this problem and the confluence start up went on up to the very same problem as reported in [CONF-11434|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-11434] for Weblogic (same workaround for this works on Websphere 6.1.0.9).
fields.summary: c3p0-0.9.1.2: Built-In JMX-Service incompatible with Websphere 6.1.0.9

fields.description:
Inserting some html code (for example image) in custom html in section {{At end of the HEAD}} will create a white space on the left most and right most of page. I use the following code to reproduce the bug: {noformat}
[test]
{noformat} Please refer to the attachment for better clarification.
